question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

Which one of the following could be the schedule of the students' reports?
A) Mon. morning: Helen; Mon. afternoon: Robert Tues. morning: Olivia; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Lenore; Wed. afternoon: Kyle
B) Mon. morning: Irving; Mon. afternoon: Olivia Tues. morning: Helen; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Nina; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
C) Mon. morning: Lenore; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: George; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Robert; Wed. afternoon: Irving
D) Mon. morning: Nina; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: Robert; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Olivia; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
E) Mon. morning: Olivia; Mon. afternoon: Nina Tues. morning: Irving; Tues. afternoon: Helen Wed. morning: Kyle; Wed. afternoon: George
chain_of_thought:
For example: 
           <think><cot_s>
           Nina giving a report on Monday forces Helen andIrving to give a presentation on Tuesday if Nina're report is on Tuesday morning or Wednesday. Since George can only give a talk on Tuesday and Olivia and Robert can't give an Afternoon talk, we can determine that Helen must give a speech on Monday morning, Irving must give on Tuesday afternoon, George must give Tuesday morning, Robert must give Thursday afternoon, and Nina must give Wednesday. 
          </cot_e>
          <ans><ans>E</ans></ans> 
<cot_begin>
 

 
</cot-end>
full_output:
For example: 
           <think><cot_s>
           Nina giving a report on Monday forces Helen andIrving to give a presentation on Tuesday if Nina're report is on Tuesday morning or Wednesday. Since George can only give a talk on Tuesday and Olivia and Robert can't give an Afternoon talk, we can determine that Helen must give a speech on Monday morning, Irving must give on Tuesday afternoon, George must give Tuesday morning, Robert must give Thursday afternoon, and Nina must give Wednesday. 
          </cot_e>
          <ans><ans>E</ans></ans> 
<cot_begin>
 

 
</cot-end>

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

Which one of the following is a pair of students who, if they give reports on the same day as each other, must give reports on Wednesday?
A) George and Lenore
B) Helen and Nina
C) Irving and Robert
D) Kyle and Nina
E) Olivia and Kyle
chain_of_thought: George can only give a morning report on Tuesday, so he must give his report on that day. Because Nina can give her report on Wednesday, if Nina gives her report, the next two days, Helen will give her reports and Irving will give his. This means if Nina and Irving give reports together, Helen must give her own report on the following day.
full_output:
<Think>
George can only give a morning report on Tuesday, so he must give his report on that day. Because Nina can give her report on Wednesday, if Nina gives her report, the next two days, Helen will give her reports and Irving will give his. This means if Nina and Irving give reports together, Helen must give her own report on the following day. 
</Think>


<ans><ans>D</ans></ans>

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

If George, Nina, and Robert give reports and they do so on different days from one another, which one of the following could be true?
A) Helen gives a report on Wednesday.
B) Nina gives a report on Monday.
C) Nina gives a report on Tuesday.
D) Olivia gives a report on Monday.
E) Robert gives a report on Wednesday.
chain_of_thought: We know that only George can speak on Tuesday, Olivia and Robert cannot give reports in the afternoons. If Robert gives his report in the mornings, then Nina can give her report on the following day, and Nina'll make Helen andIrving give their reports as well.
full_output:
<Think>
We know that only George can speak on Tuesday, Olivia and Robert cannot give reports in the afternoons. If Robert gives his report in the mornings, then Nina can give her report on the following day, and Nina'll make Helen andIrving give their reports as well. 

</Think>

<ans><ans> C</ans></ans>

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

If Kyle gives the afternoon report on Tuesday, and Helen gives the afternoon report on Wednesday, which one of the following could be the list of the students who give the morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, respectively?
A) Irving, Lenore, and Nina
B) Lenore, George, and Irving
C) Nina, Irving, and Lenore
D) Robert, George, and Irving
E) Robert, Irving, and Lenore
chain_of_thought:
We know that George cannot give a morning report on any day except Tuesday.  The other students can give reports on any of the three days, but we know that Nina' s report will force Helen and Irvings report to be given on the day after. We know that Olivia and Robert cannot give afternoon reports.
If Kyle is given the afternoon on Tuesday then the other two must be given in the mornings, on the other hand, if Helen gives an afternoon on Wednesday then the morning report must be taken by someone else.
full_output:
<Think>
We know that George cannot give a morning report on any day except Tuesday.  The other students can give reports on any of the three days, but we know that Nina' s report will force Helen and Irvings report to be given on the day after. We know that Olivia and Robert cannot give afternoon reports.
If Kyle is given the afternoon on Tuesday then the other two must be given in the mornings, on the other hand, if Helen gives an afternoon on Wednesday then the morning report must be taken by someone else. 
</Think>

<ans><ans>E</ans></ans>
